title: How to Make Old Fashioned Strawberry Cobbler

steps.headline: Wash the fruit is necessary then hull the strawberries.
Melt butter in an 8 by 12 baking dish in an oven for four minutes, or until butter is fully melted.
steps.description: Pour away any excess butter when it has all melted. Make sure you use oven mitts when handling the hot dish.

steps.headline: Add the flour, baking powder, salt, sugar, milk and cinnamon to a bowl.
Pour the mixture into it in the buttered baking dish.
Put your strawberries on.
steps.description: Arrange your strawberries, tips up, in your batter.

steps.headline: Bake your cobbler in the oven for 22-27 minutes, or until golden brown.
Serve warm (for best taste) with ice cream and enjoy!

text: Preheat oven to 400° degrees FH.  Wash the fruit is necessary then hull the strawberries.  Melt butter in an 8 by 12 baking dish in an oven for four minutes, or until butter is fully melted. Pour away any excess butter when it has all melted. Make sure you use oven mitts when handling the hot dish. Add the flour, baking powder, salt, sugar, milk and cinnamon to a bowl.  Stir until mixed together well.  Pour the mixture into it in the buttered baking dish.  Put your strawberries on. Arrange your strawberries, tips up, in your batter. Bake your cobbler in the oven for 22-27 minutes, or until golden brown.  Serve warm (for best taste) with ice cream and enjoy!
